summary:
Ivan Henriques is a transdisciplinary artist and researcher working in multimedia installations examining systems. He explores in his works hybrids of living and non-living systems creating novel approaches to investigate endangered and inhospitable ecosystems. Throughout his works he develops ways to enhance the communication between humans, other living organisms and the environment. He considers nature as inspiration and a necessary force and knowledge to shift the human-centered development of the technological world. 
Ivan is the coordinator and founder of interdisciplinary research groups as Hybrid Forms Lab (hybridformslab.org) and is the creator and coordinator of the mobile residency program EME (Estúdio Móvel Experimental -emedata.blogspot.com). His works are exhibited internationally, participating in festivals, residencies and talks. 
Henriques has been a crucial developer crossing the bridges of art/design/technology/science/engineering. He gives consultancies in interdisciplinary thinking and development as for example TU Delft, Dutch Design Week amongst others. Currently Henriques teaches Aesthetics of Interconnectedness online and also the intersections of art/design/science for students of the Autonomous Practice at Willem de Kooning Academy in Rotterdam. At the same institution Henriques is also a researcher implementing sustainability in the academy curriculum based on system thinking and making.

awards.title: prizes
awards.description: Lately he won the STW – Research Through Design Award 2017~18, Stimuleringsfonds Talent Award 2015, Proven Talent Award from Mondriaan Fonds 2013~18, New Face Award from the 18th Japan Media Arts Festival and the Honorary Mention for the [next] Idea, Ars Electronica 2014. In 2012 he was nominated for the Genomic Awards 2012 – DA4GA (NL), Henriques participated at the Salone Internazionale de Milano (IT), ISEA RUHR 2010 in Dortmund (DE), FILE- SP 2010 (BR) amongst other exhibitions and festivals, participating in talks and residency programs. Henriques holds an MA in ArtScience Interfaculty at the Royal Academy of Arts and Royal Conservatoire of Music, The Hague /NL (2009-2011). His artworks are part of relevant art/new media institutions.

ivanhenriques.com

Ivan Henriques is a transdisciplinary artist and researcher working in multimedia installations examining living systems. He explores in his works hybrids of nature and (technological) culture creating new forms of communication between humans and other living organisms. He considers nature as inspiration and a necessary factor in the development of the technological world.

He researches in various aspects of real time environment data visualization, where it becomes a motive and motor for the platform that he creates within his works. In a deep look at this information he gets from the environment and other living organisms, Ivan creates interactive and participatory art installations. His visionary combination of robotics and living organisms explores the fluidity of subject positions in the post-digital world. The audience involvement is the core of his creation, approaching all the living species to have a unique experience envisioning a new possible world where we all are hypersensitive to our surroundings. The development of smell, touch and audiovisual installations explores such concepts [1] as: the future (reinvention) of the environment; the acceleration of techno-scientific mutations; when nature becomes culture; the use of natural resources; where these hybrids of nature and technology will take place in the near future and reshape and redefine our tools to be more coherent with the world we live in.

[1]: these concepts were discussed in the e-book Oritur.

profile_positions.description: The research group "Hybrid Forms " is an interdisciplinary laboratory focusing on organisms living systems and robotics. The research group "Hybrid Forms" offers a survey focused on the local environment, mobility, sustainability, renewable energy and developing prototypes for communication design / art, tools and interfaces that are engaged with the natural environment. One goal is to unify the curriculum of the students and create a platform for research and development across disciplines.

profile_positions.description:
The Hybrid Forms Lab is an horizontal interdisciplinary research network, focusing on knowledge exchange, with a collaborative effort of scientists, engineers, programmers and artists/designers to explore environmental science, automation and living systems. In some special occasions the projects developed in the network are incorporated in the curricula of the students from the collaborative institutions around the globe. It promotes a bridge of knowledge between students and professionals.

profile_positions.description: The main focus on the research is to explore interactions in the environment and energy of living organisms to apply in the design of the bio-machines. A deep investigation and understanding of interactions of biotic and abiotic systems to be applied in the designs.  The developments of the bio-machines is an initiative to foster studies and applications focused on the convergence of human augmentation with the increasing intelligence and awareness of artifacts, leading towards a symbiosis of humans, machines, other living organisms and the environment. I have been active in the art-science scene for almost 10 years. Within my practice I reflect on the actual environmental situation, bringing out-of-the-box speculative designs. For a deep understanding of the inter-relations between the biotic and abiotic systems a multiple perspective of the environment lead to combine myself with professionals from other disciplines. The impulse to be an educator is to create this interdisciplinary platform and bridges for students to imagine and create new perspectives which are not yet envisioned, to re-think about our environment and our ways of production.

profile_positions.description:
EME - Estúdio Móvel Experimental s a mobile residency program that integrates art, science and technology to research the environment and self-sustainability. This is a project directed by artists developing an interdisciplinary research platform that has the Guanabara Bay and its surrounding Atlantic Forest in focus.

This customized vehicle travels around the state to Rio de Janeiro and begun its activity on September 2009. Resident artists and researchers will be visiting some of the cities of the State of Rio de Janeiro, as well as participating in festivals and exhibitions.

This multidisciplinary platform aims to reach a wider audience through public arts, interventions, documentation and new media communication tools. The project highlights an awareness of the environment, history and arts of the state of Rio de Janeiro.

Henriques launched EME>> (Estúdio Móvel Experimental) - Experimental Mobile Studio in 2008/2009, a project selected and funded by the Secretaria de Cultura do Estado do Rio de Janeiro which led facilities for future editions as in 2010 financed by Conexões Artes Visuais - Funarte, with four more residencies. In 2012 EME>> was only possible with support from Mondriaan Fonds.

profile_positions.description: Grupo Experimental Multidisciplinar Autônomo = G.E.M.A (concept & creation). is an artist-led conceptual framework that acts as an open interdisciplinary interface to explore the city of Rio de Janeiro and its environs with the support of international research partners of arts, sciences and technology. GEMA aims is to engage the public in the urban and natural environment through collaborative site-specific public and live arts, interventions and education programs. GEMA happened in Rio de Janeiro from 2007 until 2008.
